Edited March 28, 2018 by RedPandaz

Test Pilot Review: @CrazyJebGuy – GAI Cool Corporate Jet 

  

Figures as Tested: 

  • Price: 19,340,000 
  • Fuel: 580 Kallons 
  • Cruising Speed: 555m/s 
  • Cruising Altitude: 9,000m 
  • Fuel Burn Rate: 0.19 Kallons/sec 
  • Range: 1,700km 

Review: 

The name really says it all. But this would not be much of a review if we left it at that. We were not able to able to take off from the runway below 60m/s on the runway without also losing both engines, however with a little ingenuity in the form of a ramp, we were able to take off as slowly as 40m/s. Regardless this thing accelerates so fast it does not really matter. We also found that the plane could take off from water at 60m/s. And all this is in dry mode. We did not even bother testing take offs in wet mode, we don't think it will be necessary.  

In the air this aircraft has superb manoeuvrability and speed. We were able to push the airframe as far as 65.7Gs without any signs damage! The test pilots also found it quite fun to buzz the tower over and over, at Mach 3! Well, the aircraft can reach 1022m/s at 800m, but only for a brief time. The maintenance department was not overly impressed though, replacing all those windows will not be cheap. At 700 meters we were able to cruise in dry mode at 745m/s, though the best fuel economy we found to be at 9000m and 555m/s. Still the fuel economy of this thing is at best abysmal, and at worst amusingly bad. 

The landing gear was found to be rather quite up to the task, as the craft was stalled out several meters above the runway, and the aircraft merely shrugged, and promptly came to a stop. As you might have guessed it lands very well on water too.  

The passenger compartment is not the quietest we have heard, but at least there is a couple fuel tanks in-between them and the twin afterburning turbofans. We hope the passengers like their martinis shaken, not stirred though. 

Does this make any sense at all as a passenger jet? No! It's not especially cheap, the fuel economy is terrible, it is not very comfortable. However, we think it will be ideal for air shows and as a fancy meeting room. What better to put pressure on your partners than 65Gs? We don't expect much resistance after that. 

The verdict: 
With a passenger capacity of only 8, it really does not fit into any of our categories, but we would like to claim our free plane anyways, based off our recent order of 5 GAI Rats. 

(Please pardon the not so amazing graphics in the image my potato laptop is barely up to the task, and I will not have access to a proper gaming PC for the next few days)

Edited March 30, 2018 by neistridlar

How far is my craft to review, the Kalibu?

By the way, I just fitted a spoiler and an airbrake on one of my floatplane designs, (K-38/52) one per wing, mounted at the same part of the wing, to see what is a better airbrake. The better aircrake would turn the plane to that side, since it would slow down a lot faster. I did it on the runway, because then I don't have to worry about inflight trim. Just throttle up and go.

Place bets now, I'll reveal which is better:

Spoiler

The plane turned fairly strongly right, the side I put the spoiler on. So yeah, spoilers are better, and they cost half as much.

 

By the way, any way I can switch the 1.4 decoupler/separator skin to the older ones? It looks flipping terrible, and they all look the same, so it's hard to tell which one I'm looking at.

Edited March 29, 2018 by RedPandaz

It has been bothering me for a while now that we have not started using the badges that @hoioh made, they are just too good not to use. So I have been trying to find a good way to implement them, and I think I have a way that will fit the challenge, and can be implemented retroactively relatively easily. It goes like this:

  • Bronze: Participation trophy, you may use this when your craft has been reviewed, regardless of the outcome.
  • Silver: KEA bought at least one of your planes.
  • Gold: Mark of exemplary performance, this is exactly the kind of aircraft KEA are looking for. It has only minor issues, and is over all very suitable for the task at hand.

Bronze and Silver can be awarded retroactively by self service. For a retroactive Gold badge, people may apply for it retroactively if they think they have a chance, and the judges will take a quick look at the previous review and submission to decide if they qualify. This system is highly subjective, but that such is the nature of this challenge, so I don't think there is a way around that.

Also I think it is about time KEA gets their own flag, so I made a few proposals. I am not by any means a good graphical designer though, so if anyone thinks they can do better, feel free to build upon my designs, or scrap them and make something entirely different. I think this will be fun.

Edited March 29, 2018 by neistridlar
added link to badges
